trans-unit.source: Build and deploy a Node.js web app to Azure using WebMatrix
trans-unit.target: Build and deploy a Node.js web app to Azure using WebMatrix

trans-unit.source: A tutorial that teaches you how to use WebMatrix to develop a Node.js application and deploy it to Azure App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: A tutorial that teaches you how to use WebMatrix to develop a Node.js application and deploy it to Azure App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use WebMatrix to develop a Node.js application and deploy it to <linkText>Azure App Service</linkText><title></title> Web Apps. WebMatrix is a free web development tool from Microsoft that includes everything you need for website or web app development. WebMatrix includes several features that make it easy to use Node.js including code completion, pre-built templates, and editor support for Jade, LESS, and CoffeeScript. Learn more about <linkText>WebMatrix for Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use WebMatrix to develop a Node.js application and deploy it to <linkText>Azure App Service</linkText><title></title> Web Apps. WebMatrix is a free web development tool from Microsoft that includes everything you need for website or web app development. WebMatrix includes several features that make it easy to use Node.js including code completion, pre-built templates, and editor support for Jade, LESS, and CoffeeScript. Learn more about <linkText>WebMatrix for Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Upon completing this guide, you will have a Node.js web app running in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Upon completing this guide, you will have a Node.js web app running in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot of the completed application is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot of the completed application is below:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure node Web site</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure node Web site</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create a web app in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create a web app in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Launch WebMatrix
trans-unit.target: Launch WebMatrix

trans-unit.source: If this is the first time you've used WebMatrix, you will be prompted to sign into Azure.
trans-unit.target: If this is the first time you've used WebMatrix, you will be prompted to sign into Azure.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you can click on the Sign In button, and choose Add Account.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you can click on the Sign In button, and choose Add Account.

trans-unit.source: Select to Sign in using your Microsoft Account.
trans-unit.target: Select to Sign in using your Microsoft Account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have signed up for an Azure account, you may log in using your Microsoft Account:
trans-unit.target: If you have signed up for an Azure account, you may log in using your Microsoft Account:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sign into Azure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sign into Azure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the start screen, click the New button, and choose Template Gallery to create a new site from the Template Gallery:
trans-unit.target: On the start screen, click the New button, and choose Template Gallery to create a new site from the Template Gallery:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New site from Template Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New site from Template Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Site from Template dialog, select Node and then select Express Site.
trans-unit.target: In the Site from Template dialog, select Node and then select Express Site.

trans-unit.source: Finally, click Next.
trans-unit.target: Finally, click Next.

trans-unit.source: If you are missing any prerequisites for the Express Site template, you will be prompted to install them.
trans-unit.target: If you are missing any prerequisites for the Express Site template, you will be prompted to install them.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>select express template</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>select express template</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you are signed into Azure, you now have the option to create an App Service web app for your local site.
trans-unit.target: If you are signed into Azure, you now have the option to create an App Service web app for your local site.

trans-unit.source: Choose a unique name, and select the datacenter where you would like your App Service web app to be created:
trans-unit.target: Choose a unique name, and select the datacenter where you would like your App Service web app to be created:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create site on Azure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create site on Azure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After WebMatrix finishes building the local site and creating the App Service web app, the WebMatrix IDE is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After WebMatrix finishes building the local site and creating the App Service web app, the WebMatrix IDE is displayed.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>webmatrix ide</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>webmatrix ide</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In WebMatrix, click Publish from the Home ribbon to display the Publish Preview dialog box for the site.
trans-unit.target: In WebMatrix, click Publish from the Home ribbon to display the Publish Preview dialog box for the site.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>publish preview</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>publish preview</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Click Continue.

trans-unit.source: When publishing is complete, the URL for the App Service web app is displayed at the bottom of the WebMatrix IDE
trans-unit.target: When publishing is complete, the URL for the App Service web app is displayed at the bottom of the WebMatrix IDE

trans-unit.source: <linkText>publish complete</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>publish complete</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the link to open the App Service web app in your browser.
trans-unit.target: Click the link to open the App Service web app in your browser.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Express web app</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Express web app</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can easily modify and republish your application.
trans-unit.target: You can easily modify and republish your application.

trans-unit.source: Here, you will make a simple change to the heading in in the index.jade file, and republish the application.
trans-unit.target: Here, you will make a simple change to the heading in in the index.jade file, and republish the application.

trans-unit.source: In WebMatrix, select Files, and then expend the views folder.
trans-unit.target: In WebMatrix, select Files, and then expend the views folder.

trans-unit.source: Open the index.jade file by double-clicking it.
trans-unit.target: Open the index.jade file by double-clicking it.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>webmatrix viewing index.jade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>webmatrix viewing index.jade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Change the second line to the following:
trans-unit.target: Change the second line to the following:

trans-unit.source: Save your changes, and then click the publish icon.
trans-unit.target: Save your changes, and then click the publish icon.

trans-unit.source: Finally, click Continue in the Publish Preview dialog and wait for the update to be published.
trans-unit.target: Finally, click Continue in the Publish Preview dialog and wait for the update to be published.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>publish preview</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>publish preview</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When publishing has completed, use the link returned when the publish process is complete to see the updated App Service web app.
trans-unit.target: When publishing has completed, use the link returned when the publish process is complete to see the updated App Service web app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure node web app</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure node web app</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To learn more about the versions of Node.js that are provided with Azure and how to specify the version to be used with your application, see <linkText>Specifying a Node.js version in an Azure application</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about the versions of Node.js that are provided with Azure and how to specify the version to be used with your application, see <linkText>Specifying a Node.js version in an Azure application</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you encounter problems with your application after it has been deployed to Azure, see <linkText>How to debug a Node.js web app in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title> for information on diagnosing the problem.
trans-unit.target: If you encounter problems with your application after it has been deployed to Azure, see <linkText>How to debug a Node.js web app in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title> for information on diagnosing the problem.

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: <linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: <linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title>
